channel.title: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?
channel.description:
[img]http://img291.imageshack.us/img291/5388/tempsw.png[/img]
Laptop is a year old (367 days to be exact :o), processor is the Core i5 430m @ 2.27GHz (turbo to 2.53GHz).
The image was taken when just casually running itunes, chrome, runescape, + 2 runescape bots. I am using a high powered zalman cooler with dual fans which cost me 40 quid, and yet the temperatures are still reaching pretty high.
When playing BF:BC2 the temperatures on all 4 cores will rise to around 98C, and on bad days it'll shut it self off (which is around 103C I believe?) I doubt this is anything to do with poor ventilation.

item.source: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?

item.title: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Niall:

[quote author=SilentCJ link=topic=482081.msg3531437#msg3531437 date=1300210703]Just saying though, can overheating it cause long term damage to the components?

it depends on how hot and how long it remains at high temps but laptops are designed to run hot without a problem, just make sure there’s no major dust blocking the in/outtake and try not to block it too much and you shouldn’t have a problem, even if it is hot to touch

something to look out for however is a hot(40c+?) harddrive, you’ll probably experience faulty harddrives before anything else if it’s frequently running hot[/quote]
Well, it auto shuts down at around 105C so not too long.
And my second internal hard drive of 160gb always runs at 50C+, managed to reach 65C last night , not too bothered about it though, it’s an old hdd I just took from my old dead motherboard laptop.

Just took it apart and cleaned it, whole process took almost 3 hours
I reckon this could’ve been the problem:

Stress tested it for a full 5 minutes and the hottest it reached was 68C

Read full topic
item.source: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?

item.title: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

SilentCJ:

Just saying though, can overheating it cause long term damage to the components?

it depends on how hot and how long it remains at high temps but laptops are designed to run hot without a problem, just make sure there’s no major dust blocking the in/outtake and try not to block it too much and you shouldn’t have a problem, even if it is hot to touch

something to look out for however is a hot(40c+?) harddrive, you’ll probably experience faulty harddrives before anything else if it’s frequently running hot

Read full topic
item.source: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?

item.title: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Moparisthebest:

Don’t block the ventilation ever! If you have to take the covers off the bed do so.

Yeah haha, learnt from my mistakes after several times of doing it, now always use my cooling pad wherever I go

Read full topic
item.source: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?

item.source: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?

item.title: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Thug-life:

Oh, if it turns off, then there is something wrong. Is it still in warranty?

I don’t think there’s something wrong as such, it only used to do that when playing black ops and whatnot on my bed, duvet blocks ventilation etc.
Just saying though, can overheating it cause long term damage to the components? And would this possibly cause the thermal compound to be rendered useless in a smaller period of time?

And no, 1 year warranty expired just 3 days ago now, shame.

Read full topic
item.source: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?

item.title: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?

item.source: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?

item.title: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?
item.dc:creator: @SilentCJ SilentCJ
item.description:
@SilentCJ wrote:

Thug-life:

Laptops, especially those with these i series CPUs idle quite high, but they’re designed to withstand that. I wouldn’t worry about it too much.

I did search around a little on google and also found that, but I didn’t see any temperatures quite as high as mine, I mean, 95C is when the whole system begins slowing down.

Also, does overheating it so much that it turns off, several times have any long term damage?

Read full topic
item.source: [SOLVED] Should I replace laptop CPU thermal paste?

item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Casually running 3 instances of runescape (and a bunch of other stuff)? That puts a heavy load on a CPU, as you can see, so it should get hot. Don’t know if it should get quite that hot though.

Read full topic
